name: Johnny Pacheco
description:
'''Juan Pablo Knipping Pacheco''' (25 March 1935 â€“ 15 February 2021), known as '''Johnny Pacheco''', was a Dominican musician, arranger, composer, bandleader, and record producer. Born in the [[Dominican Republic]], Pacheco became a leading figure in the New York [[salsa music|salsa]] scene in the 1960s and 1970s as the founder and musical director of [[Fania Records]].

Pacheco was one of the leading exponents of [[pachanga]], a blend of [[Culture of Cuba|Cuban]] rhythms and [[Music of the Dominican Republic|Dominican]] [[Merengue music|merengue]] in the late 1950s. He popularized the use of the term "salsa" and established the [[Fania All-Stars]] to showcase the leading artists of the genre, which propelled him to worldwide fame and had an important role in the evolution of [[Latin music]].

Pacheco was a nine-time [[Latin Grammy Award|Grammy]] nominee and was awarded the [[Latin Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award]] by [[the Latin Recording Academy]] in 2005.
